function stripe.resources.Skus.prototype.create ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Skus.prototype.create = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Sources.prototype.verify ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Sources.prototype.verify = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Subscriptions.prototype.create ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Subscriptions.prototype.create = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    resources.Subscriptions.prototype.deleteDiscount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

function stripe.resources.Subscriptions.prototype.update ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Subscriptions.prototype.update = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'

          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

  }).bind(this)), callback);

function stripe.resources.Transfers.prototype.cancel ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Transfers.prototype.cancel = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'

          continue;

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();

    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);

      if (err) {
        reject(err);

          spec.transformResponseData ?

  }).bind(this)), callback);

    resources.Transfers.prototype.createReversal = function () {
  var self = this;

    resources.Transfers.prototype.listReversals = function () {

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

  }).bind(this)), callback);

function stripe.resources.Transfers.prototype.retrieveReversal ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Transfers.prototype.retrieveReversal = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Transfers.prototype.reverse ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Transfers.prototype.reverse = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Transfers.prototype.updateReversal ()

  • description and source-code
    resources.Transfers.prototype.updateReversal = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.toString ()

  • description and source-code
    toString = function () {
    return text;
}
  • example usage
    ...

'use strict';

// Method for formatting HTTP body for the multipart/form-data specification
// Mostly taken from Fermata.js
// https://github.com/natevw/fermata/blob/5d9732a33d776ce925013a265935facd1626cc88/fermata.js#L315-L343
function multipartDataGenerator(method, data, headers) {
var segno = (Math.round(Math.random() * 1e16) + Math.round(Math.random() * 1e16)).toString();
headers['Content-Type'] = ('multipart/form-data; boundary=' + segno);
var buffer = new Buffer(0);

function push(l) {
  var prevBuffer = buffer;
  var newBuffer = (l instanceof Buffer) ? l : new Buffer(l);
  buffer = new Buffer(prevBuffer.length + newBuffer.length + 2);
...

module stripe.Error

function stripe.Error (raw)

  • description and source-code
    function _Error(raw) {
  this.populate.apply(this, arguments);
  this.stack = (new Error(this.message)).stack;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.Error.StripeAPIError ()

  • description and source-code
    StripeAPIError = function () {
  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    ...
StripeError.generate = function(rawStripeError) {
  switch (rawStripeError.type) {
    case 'card_error':
      return new _Error.StripeCardError(rawStripeError);
    case 'invalid_request_error':
      return new _Error.StripeInvalidRequestError(rawStripeError);
    case 'api_error':
      return new _Error.StripeAPIError(rawStripeError);
  }
  return new _Error('Generic', 'Unknown Error');
};

// Specific Stripe Error types:
_Error.StripeCardError = StripeError.extend({type: 'StripeCardError'});
_Error.StripeInvalidRequestError = StripeError.extend({type: 'StripeInvalidRequestError'});
...

  • description and source-code

  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    ...

/**
 * Helper factory which takes raw stripe errors and outputs wrapping instances
 */
StripeError.generate = function(rawStripeError) {
  switch (rawStripeError.type) {
    case 'card_error':
      return new _Error.StripeCardError(rawStripeError);
    case 'invalid_request_error':
      return new _Error.StripeInvalidRequestError(rawStripeError);
    case 'api_error':
      return new _Error.StripeAPIError(rawStripeError);
  }
  return new _Error('Generic', 'Unknown Error');
};
...

 * Helper factory which takes raw stripe errors and outputs wrapping instances

    case 'card_error':
      return new _Error.StripeCardError(rawStripeError);
    case 'invalid_request_error':
      return new _Error.StripeInvalidRequestError(rawStripeError);
    case 'api_error':
      return new _Error.StripeAPIError(rawStripeError);
  }
  return new _Error('Generic', 'Unknown Error');

function stripe.Error.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

  • description and source-code
    populate = function (type, message) {
  this.type = type;
  this.message = message;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.MultipartDataGenerator

function stripe.MultipartDataGenerator (method, data, headers)

  • description and source-code
    function multipartDataGenerator(method, data, headers) {
  var segno = (Math.round(Math.random() * 1e16) + Math.round(Math.random() * 1e16)).toString();
  headers['Content-Type'] = ('multipart/form-data; boundary=' + segno);
  var buffer = new Buffer(0);

  function push(l) {
    var prevBuffer = buffer;
    var newBuffer = (l instanceof Buffer) ? l : new Buffer(l);
    buffer = new Buffer(prevBuffer.length + newBuffer.length + 2);
    prevBuffer.copy(buffer);
    newBuffer.copy(buffer, prevBuffer.length);
    buffer.write('\r\n', buffer.length - 2);
  }

  function q(s) {
    return '"' + s.replace(/"|"/g, '%22').replace(/\r\n|\r|\n/g, ' ') + '"';
  }

  for (var k in data) {
    var v = data[k];
    push('--' + segno);
    if (v.hasOwnProperty('data')) {
      push('Content-Disposition: form-data; name=' + q(k) + '; filename=' + q(v.name || 'blob'));
      push('Content-Type: ' + (v.type || 'application/octet-stream'));
      push('');
      push(v.data);
    } else {
      push('Content-Disposition: form-data; name=' + q(k));
      push('');
      push(v);
    }
  };
  push('--' + segno + '--');

  return buffer;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource

function stripe.StripeResource (stripe, urlData)

  • description and source-code
    function StripeResource(stripe, urlData) {
  this._stripe = stripe;
  this._urlData = urlData || {};

  this.basePath = utils.makeURLInterpolator(stripe.getApiField('basePath'));
  this.resourcePath = this.path;
  this.path = utils.makeURLInterpolator(this.path);

  if (this.includeBasic) {
    this.includeBasic.forEach(function(methodName) {
      this[methodName] = StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS[methodName];
    }, this);
  }

  this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.StripeResource.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.create ()

  • description and source-code
    create = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    ...
The package needs to be configured with your account's secret key which is
available in your [Stripe Dashboard][api-keys]. Require it with the key's
value:

``` js
var stripe = require('stripe')('sk_test_...');

stripe.customers.create(
  { email: 'customer@example.com' },
  function(err, customer) {
    err; // null if no error occurred
    customer; // the created customer object
  }
);
```
...

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.del ()

  • description and source-code
    del = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.getMetadata (id, auth, cb)

  • description and source-code
    getMetadata = function (id, auth, cb) {
  if (!cb && typeof auth == 'function') {
    cb = auth;
    auth = null;
  }

  var urlData = this.createUrlData();
  var path = this.createFullPath('/' + id, urlData);

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    this._request('GET', path, {}, auth, {}, function(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(response.metadata);
      }
    });
  }).bind(this)), cb);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.list ()

  • description and source-code
    list = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.retrieve ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieve = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    ...
### Configuring For Connect

A per-request `Stripe-Account` header for use with [Stripe Connect][connect]
can be added to any method:

``` js
// Retrieve the balance for a connected account:
stripe.balance.retrieve({
  stripe_account: "acct_foo"
}).then(function(balance) {
  // The balance object for the connected account
}).catch(function(err) {
  // Error
});
```
...

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.setMetadata (id, key, value, auth, cb)

  • description and source-code
    setMetadata = function (id, key, value, auth, cb) {
  var self = this;
  var data = key;
  var isObject = isPlainObject(key);
  // We assume null for an empty object
  var isNull = data === null || (isObject && !Object.keys(data).length);

  // Allow optional passing of auth & cb:
  if ((isNull || isObject) && typeof value == 'string') {
    auth = value;
  } else if (typeof auth != 'string') {
    if (!cb && typeof auth == 'function') {
      cb = auth;
    }
    auth = null;
  }

  var urlData = this.createUrlData();
  var path = this.createFullPath('/' + id, urlData);

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    if (isNull) {
      // Reset metadata:
      sendMetadata(null, auth);
    } else if (!isObject) {
      // Set individual metadata property:
      var metadata = {};
      metadata[key] = value;
      sendMetadata(metadata, auth);
    } else {
      // Set entire metadata object after resetting it:
      this._request('POST', path, {
        metadata: null,
      }, auth, {}, function(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          return reject(err);
        }
        sendMetadata(data, auth);
      });
    }

    function sendMetadata(metadata, auth) {
      self._request('POST', path, {
        metadata: metadata,
      }, auth, {}, function(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(response.metadata);
        }
      });
    }
  }).bind(this)), cb);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.BASIC_METHODS.update ()

  • description and source-code
    update = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.extend

function stripe.StripeResource.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

module stripe.StripeResource.method

function stripe.StripeResource.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._errorHandler (req, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _errorHandler = function (req, callback) {
  var self = this;
  return function(error) {
    if (req._isAborted) {
      // already handled
      return;
    }
    callback.call(
      self,
      new Error.StripeConnectionError({
        message: 'An error occurred with our connection to Stripe',
        detail: error,
      }),
      null
    );
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._request (method, path, data, auth, options, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _request = function (method, path, data, auth, options, callback) {
  var self = this;
  var requestData;

  if (self.requestDataProcessor) {
    requestData = self.requestDataProcessor(method, data, options.headers);
  } else {
    requestData = utils.stringifyRequestData(data || {});
  }

  var apiVersion = this._stripe.getApiField('version');

  var headers = {
    // Use specified auth token or use default from this stripe instance:
    'Authorization': auth ?
      'Basic ' + new Buffer(auth + ':').toString('base64') :
      this._stripe.getApiField('auth'),
    'Accept': 'application/json',
    'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
    'Content-Length': requestData.length,
    'User-Agent': 'Stripe/v1 NodeBindings/' + this._stripe.getConstant('PACKAGE_VERSION'),
  };

  if (apiVersion) {
    headers['Stripe-Version'] = apiVersion;
  }

  // Grab client-user-agent before making the request:
  this._stripe.getClientUserAgent(function(cua) {
    headers['X-Stripe-Client-User-Agent'] = cua;

    if (options.headers) {
      objectAssign(headers, options.headers);
    }

    makeRequest();
  });

  function makeRequest() {
    var timeout = self._stripe.getApiField('timeout');
    var isInsecureConnection = self._stripe.getApiField('protocol') == 'http';

    var host = self.overrideHost || self._stripe.getApiField('host');

    var req = (
      isInsecureConnection ? http : https
    ).request({
      host: host,
      port: self._stripe.getApiField('port'),
      path: path,
      method: method,
      agent: self._stripe.getApiField('agent'),
      headers: headers,
      ciphers: 'DEFAULT:!aNULL:!eNULL:!LOW:!EXPORT:!SSLv2:!MD5',
    });

    req.setTimeout(timeout, self._timeoutHandler(timeout, req, callback));
    req.on('response', self._responseHandler(req, callback));
    req.on('error', self._errorHandler(req, callback));

    req.on('socket', function(socket) {
      socket.on((isInsecureConnection ? 'connect' : 'secureConnect'), function() {
        // Send payload; we're safe:
        req.write(requestData);
        req.end();
      });
    });
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._responseHandler (req, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _responseHandler = function (req, callback) {
  var self = this;
  return function(res) {
    var response = '';

    res.setEncoding('utf8');
    res.on('data', function(chunk) {
      response += chunk;
    });
    res.on('end', function() {
      var headers = res.headers || {};

      try {
        response = JSON.parse(response);

        // For convenience, make Request-Id easily accessible on
        // lastResponse.
        res.requestId = headers['request-id'];

        if (response.error) {
          var err;

          // These are now available on the top-level resource's
          // lastResponse, but we keep them here too for backwards
          // compatibility.
          response.error.statusCode = res.statusCode;
          response.error.requestId = res.requestId;

          if (res.statusCode === 401) {
            err = new Error.StripeAuthenticationError(response.error);
          } else if (res.statusCode === 403) {
            err = new Error.StripePermissionError(response.error);
          } else if (res.statusCode === 429) {
            err = new Error.StripeRateLimitError(response.error);
          } else {
            err = Error.StripeError.generate(response.error);
          }
          return callback.call(self, err, null);
        }
      } catch (e) {
        return callback.call(
          self,
          new Error.StripeAPIError({
            message: 'Invalid JSON received from the Stripe API',
            response: response,
            exception: e,
            requestId: headers['request-id'],
          }),
          null
        );
      }
      // Expose res object
      Object.defineProperty(response, 'lastResponse', {
        enumerable: false,
        writable: false,
        value: res,
      });
      callback.call(self, null, response);
    });
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._timeoutHandler (timeout, req, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _timeoutHandler = function (timeout, req, callback) {
  var self = this;
  return function() {
    var timeoutErr = new Error('ETIMEDOUT');
    timeoutErr.code = 'ETIMEDOUT';

    req._isAborted = true;
    req.abort();

    callback.call(
      self,
      new Error.StripeConnectionError({
        message: 'Request aborted due to timeout being reached (' + timeout + 'ms)',
        detail: timeoutErr,
      }),
      null
    );
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createFullPath (commandPath, urlData)

  • description and source-code
    createFullPath = function (commandPath, urlData) {
  return path.join(
    this.basePath(urlData),
    this.path(urlData),
    typeof commandPath == 'function' ?
      commandPath(urlData) : commandPath
  ).replace(/\\/g, '/'); // ugly workaround for Windows
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createResourcePathWithSymbols (pathWithSymbols)

  • description and source-code
    createResourcePathWithSymbols = function (pathWithSymbols) {
  return '/' + path.join(
    this.resourcePath,
    pathWithSymbols
  ).replace(/\\/g, '/'); // ugly workaround for Windows
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createUrlData ()

  • description and source-code
    createUrlData = function () {
  var urlData = {};
  // Merge in baseData
  for (var i in this._urlData) {
    if (hasOwn.call(this._urlData, i)) {
      urlData[i] = this._urlData[i];
    }
  }
  return urlData;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.initialize ()

  • description and source-code
    initialize = function () {}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.wrapTimeout (promise, callback)

  • description and source-code
    wrapTimeout = function (promise, callback) {
  if (callback) {
    // Ensure callback is called outside of promise stack.
    return promise.then(function(res) {
      setTimeout(function() { callback(null, res) }, 0);
    }, function(err) {
      setTimeout(function() { callback(err, null); }, 0);
    });
  }

  return promise;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype._errorHandler

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._errorHandler (req, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _errorHandler = function (req, callback) {
  var self = this;
  return function(error) {
    if (req._isAborted) {
      // already handled
      return;
    }
    callback.call(
      self,
      new Error.StripeConnectionError({
        message: 'An error occurred with our connection to Stripe',
        detail: error,
      }),
      null
    );
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype._request

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._request (method, path, data, auth, options, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _request = function (method, path, data, auth, options, callback) {
  var self = this;
  var requestData;

  if (self.requestDataProcessor) {
    requestData = self.requestDataProcessor(method, data, options.headers);
  } else {
    requestData = utils.stringifyRequestData(data || {});
  }

  var apiVersion = this._stripe.getApiField('version');

  var headers = {
    // Use specified auth token or use default from this stripe instance:
    'Authorization': auth ?
      'Basic ' + new Buffer(auth + ':').toString('base64') :
      this._stripe.getApiField('auth'),
    'Accept': 'application/json',
    'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
    'Content-Length': requestData.length,
    'User-Agent': 'Stripe/v1 NodeBindings/' + this._stripe.getConstant('PACKAGE_VERSION'),
  };

  if (apiVersion) {
    headers['Stripe-Version'] = apiVersion;
  }

  // Grab client-user-agent before making the request:
  this._stripe.getClientUserAgent(function(cua) {
    headers['X-Stripe-Client-User-Agent'] = cua;

    if (options.headers) {
      objectAssign(headers, options.headers);
    }

    makeRequest();
  });

  function makeRequest() {
    var timeout = self._stripe.getApiField('timeout');
    var isInsecureConnection = self._stripe.getApiField('protocol') == 'http';

    var host = self.overrideHost || self._stripe.getApiField('host');

    var req = (
      isInsecureConnection ? http : https
    ).request({
      host: host,
      port: self._stripe.getApiField('port'),
      path: path,
      method: method,
      agent: self._stripe.getApiField('agent'),
      headers: headers,
      ciphers: 'DEFAULT:!aNULL:!eNULL:!LOW:!EXPORT:!SSLv2:!MD5',
    });

    req.setTimeout(timeout, self._timeoutHandler(timeout, req, callback));
    req.on('response', self._responseHandler(req, callback));
    req.on('error', self._errorHandler(req, callback));

    req.on('socket', function(socket) {
      socket.on((isInsecureConnection ? 'connect' : 'secureConnect'), function() {
        // Send payload; we're safe:
        req.write(requestData);
        req.end();
      });
    });
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype._responseHandler

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype._responseHandler (req, callback)

  • description and source-code
    _responseHandler = function (req, callback) {
  var self = this;
  return function(res) {
    var response = '';

    res.setEncoding('utf8');
    res.on('data', function(chunk) {
      response += chunk;
    });
    res.on('end', function() {
      var headers = res.headers || {};

      try {
        response = JSON.parse(response);

        // For convenience, make Request-Id easily accessible on
        // lastResponse.
        res.requestId = headers['request-id'];

        if (response.error) {
          var err;

          // These are now available on the top-level resource's
          // lastResponse, but we keep them here too for backwards
          // compatibility.
          response.error.statusCode = res.statusCode;
          response.error.requestId = res.requestId;

          if (res.statusCode === 401) {
            err = new Error.StripeAuthenticationError(response.error);
          } else if (res.statusCode === 403) {
            err = new Error.StripePermissionError(response.error);
          } else if (res.statusCode === 429) {
            err = new Error.StripeRateLimitError(response.error);
          } else {
            err = Error.StripeError.generate(response.error);
          }
          return callback.call(self, err, null);
        }
      } catch (e) {
        return callback.call(
          self,
          new Error.StripeAPIError({
            message: 'Invalid JSON received from the Stripe API',
            response: response,
            exception: e,
            requestId: headers['request-id'],
          }),
          null
        );
      }
      // Expose res object
      Object.defineProperty(response, 'lastResponse', {
        enumerable: false,
        writable: false,
        value: res,
      });
      callback.call(self, null, response);
    });
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

    _timeoutHandler = function (timeout, req, callback) {
  var self = this;
  return function() {
    var timeoutErr = new Error('ETIMEDOUT');
    timeoutErr.code = 'ETIMEDOUT';

    req._isAborted = true;
    req.abort();

    callback.call(
      self,
      new Error.StripeConnectionError({
        message: 'Request aborted due to timeout being reached (' + timeout + 'ms)',
        detail: timeoutErr,
      }),
      null
    );
  }
}

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createFullPath

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createFullPath (commandPath, urlData)

  • description and source-code
    createFullPath = function (commandPath, urlData) {
  return path.join(
    this.basePath(urlData),
    this.path(urlData),
    typeof commandPath == 'function' ?
      commandPath(urlData) : commandPath
  ).replace(/\\/g, '/'); // ugly workaround for Windows
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createResourcePathWithSymbols

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createResourcePathWithSymbols (pathWithSymbols)

  • description and source-code
    createResourcePathWithSymbols = function (pathWithSymbols) {
  return '/' + path.join(
    this.resourcePath,
    pathWithSymbols
  ).replace(/\\/g, '/'); // ugly workaround for Windows
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createUrlData

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.createUrlData ()

  • description and source-code
    createUrlData = function () {
  var urlData = {};
  // Merge in baseData
  for (var i in this._urlData) {
    if (hasOwn.call(this._urlData, i)) {
      urlData[i] = this._urlData[i];
    }
  }
  return urlData;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype.initialize

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.initialize ()

  • description and source-code
    initialize = function () {}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.StripeResource.prototype.wrapTimeout

function stripe.StripeResource.prototype.wrapTimeout (promise, callback)

  • description and source-code
    wrapTimeout = function (promise, callback) {
  if (callback) {
    // Ensure callback is called outside of promise stack.
    return promise.then(function(res) {
      setTimeout(function() { callback(null, res) }, 0);
    }, function(err) {
      setTimeout(function() { callback(err, null); }, 0);
    });
  }

  return promise;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Account

  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Account.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.Account.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.create ()

  • description and source-code
    create = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    ...
The package needs to be configured with your account's secret key which is
available in your [Stripe Dashboard][api-keys]. Require it with the key's
value:

``` js
var stripe = require('stripe')('sk_test_...');

stripe.customers.create(
  { email: 'customer@example.com' },
  function(err, customer) {
    err; // null if no error occurred
    customer; // the created customer object
  }
);
```
...

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.createExternalAccount ()

    createExternalAccount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.del ()

  • description and source-code
    del = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.deleteExternalAccount ()

  • description and source-code
    deleteExternalAccount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        return;

    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'

      reject(err);
      return;

      if (err) {
        reject(err);

        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.list ()

  • description and source-code
    list = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
