function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.listExternalAccounts ()

  • description and source-code
    listExternalAccounts = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.reject ()

  • description and source-code
    reject = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.retrieve (id)

  • description and source-code
    retrieve = function (id) {
  // No longer allow an api key to be passed as the first string to this function due to ambiguity between
  // old account ids and api keys. To request the account for an api key, send null as the id
  if (typeof id === 'string') {
    return stripeMethod({
      method: 'GET',
      path: 'accounts/{id}',
      urlParams: ['id'],
    }).apply(this, arguments);
  } else {
    if (id === null || id === undefined) {
      // Remove id as stripeMethod would complain of unexpected argument
      [].shift.apply(arguments);
    }
    return stripeMethod({
      method: 'GET',
      path: 'account',
    }).apply(this, arguments);
  }
}
  • example usage
    ...
### Configuring For Connect

A per-request `Stripe-Account` header for use with [Stripe Connect][connect]
can be added to any method:

``` js
// Retrieve the balance for a connected account:
stripe.balance.retrieve({
  stripe_account: "acct_foo"
}).then(function(balance) {
  // The balance object for the connected account
}).catch(function(err) {
  // Error
});
```
...

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.retrieveExternalAccount ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieveExternalAccount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.update ()

  • description and source-code
    update = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'

        return;

          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'

    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    create = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    ...
The package needs to be configured with your account's secret key which is
available in your [Stripe Dashboard][api-keys]. Require it with the key's
value:

``` js
var stripe = require('stripe')('sk_test_...');

stripe.customers.create(
  { email: 'customer@example.com' },
  function(err, customer) {
    err; // null if no error occurred
    customer; // the created customer object
  }
);
```
...

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype.createExternalAccount

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.createExternalAccount ()

  • description and source-code
    createExternalAccount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype.del

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.del ()

  • description and source-code
    del = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    deleteExternalAccount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'

          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      var err = new Error(

        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype.list

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.list ()

  • description and source-code
    list = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype.listExternalAccounts

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.listExternalAccounts ()

  • description and source-code
    listExternalAccounts = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype.reject

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.reject ()

  • description and source-code
    reject = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Account.prototype.retrieve

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.retrieve (id)

  • description and source-code
    retrieve = function (id) {
  // No longer allow an api key to be passed as the first string to this function due to ambiguity between
  // old account ids and api keys. To request the account for an api key, send null as the id
  if (typeof id === 'string') {
    return stripeMethod({
      method: 'GET',
      path: 'accounts/{id}',
      urlParams: ['id'],
    }).apply(this, arguments);
  } else {
    if (id === null || id === undefined) {
      // Remove id as stripeMethod would complain of unexpected argument
      [].shift.apply(arguments);
    }
    return stripeMethod({
      method: 'GET',
      path: 'account',
    }).apply(this, arguments);
  }
}
  • example usage
    ...
### Configuring For Connect

A per-request `Stripe-Account` header for use with [Stripe Connect][connect]
can be added to any method:

``` js
// Retrieve the balance for a connected account:
stripe.balance.retrieve({
  stripe_account: "acct_foo"
}).then(function(balance) {
  // The balance object for the connected account
}).catch(function(err) {
  // Error
});
```
...

function stripe.resources.Account.prototype.retrieveExternalAccount ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieveExternalAccount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    update = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);

module stripe.resources.ApplePayDomains

function stripe.resources.ApplePayDomains ()

  • description and source-code
    ApplePayDomains = function () {
  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.ApplePayDomains.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.ApplePayDomains.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • example usage

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFeeRefunds.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFeeRefunds.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.createRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    createRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    listRefunds = function () {
  var self = this;

  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    refund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'

        );

        return;

    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'

      return;

            response

      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    retrieveRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      var param = urlParams[i];

      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        return;

  }).bind(this)), callback);

module stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.createRefund

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.createRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    createRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    listRefunds = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

        return;

    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );

      return;

        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.refund ()

  • description and source-code
    refund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

module stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.retrieveRefund

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.retrieveRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieveRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.updateRefund

function stripe.resources.ApplicationFees.prototype.updateRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    updateRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Balance

function stripe.resources.Balance ()

  • description and source-code
    Balance = function () {
  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Balance.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.Balance.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Balance.prototype

function stripe.resources.Balance.prototype.listTransactions ()

  • description and source-code
    listTransactions = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    retrieve = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

      if (err) {
        reject(err);

        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    ...
### Configuring For Connect

A per-request `Stripe-Account` header for use with [Stripe Connect][connect]
can be added to any method:

``` js
// Retrieve the balance for a connected account:
stripe.balance.retrieve({
  stripe_account: "acct_foo"
}).then(function(balance) {
  // The balance object for the connected account
}).catch(function(err) {
  // Error
});
```
...

function stripe.resources.Balance.prototype.retrieveTransaction ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieveTransaction = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;

      if (err) {
        reject(err);

          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

  }).bind(this)), callback);

  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {

        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );

      return;

      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    retrieveTransaction = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

          continue;

        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'

            spec.transformResponseData(response) :

  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.BitcoinReceivers.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.BitcoinReceivers.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.BitcoinReceivers.prototype

function stripe.resources.BitcoinReceivers.prototype.listTransactions ()

  • description and source-code
    listTransactions = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.BitcoinReceivers.prototype.listTransactions ()

  • description and source-code
    listTransactions = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
