          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

module stripe.resources.ChargeRefunds

function stripe.resources.ChargeRefunds ()

  • description and source-code
    ChargeRefunds = function () {
  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.ChargeRefunds.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.ChargeRefunds.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}

function stripe.resources.Charges.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}

function stripe.resources.Charges.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}

module stripe.resources.Charges.prototype

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.capture ()

  • description and source-code
    capture = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

  • description and source-code
    closeDispute = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      var param = urlParams[i];

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );

          continue;

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;

      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.createRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    createRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.listRefunds ()

  • description and source-code
    listRefunds = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.refund ()

  • description and source-code
    refund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.retrieveRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieveRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.updateDispute ()

  • description and source-code
    updateDispute = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

          continue;

        );
        reject(err);
        return;

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'

      return;

        reject(err);

          spec.transformResponseData ?

            response

      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

  • description and source-code
    capture = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

      if (err) {
        reject(err);

        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response

      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);

module stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.createRefund

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.createRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    createRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

    listRefunds = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {

  • description and source-code
    refund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.retrieveRefund

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.retrieveRefund ()

  • description and source-code
    retrieveRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.updateDispute

function stripe.resources.Charges.prototype.updateDispute ()

  • description and source-code
    updateDispute = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

  • description and source-code
    updateRefund = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'

        reject(err);
        return;

          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

module stripe.resources.CountrySpecs

function stripe.resources.CountrySpecs ()

  • description and source-code
    CountrySpecs = function () {
  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.CountrySpecs.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.CountrySpecs.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}

    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}

    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

            continue;

            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}

    n/a

module stripe.resources.CustomerSubscriptions.prototype

function stripe.resources.CustomerSubscriptions.prototype.deleteDiscount ()

  • description and source-code
    deleteDiscount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.CustomerSubscriptions.prototype.deleteDiscount

function stripe.resources.CustomerSubscriptions.prototype.deleteDiscount ()

  • description and source-code
    deleteDiscount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

module stripe.resources.Customers

function stripe.resources.Customers ()

  • description and source-code
    Customers = function () {
  Super.apply(this, arguments);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Customers.extend (sub)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (sub) {
  var Super = this;
  var Constructor = hasOwn.call(sub, 'constructor') ? sub.constructor : function() {
    Super.apply(this, arguments);
  };
  Constructor.prototype = Object.create(Super.prototype);
  for (var i in sub) {
    if (hasOwn.call(sub, i)) {
      Constructor.prototype[i] = sub[i];
    }
  }
  for (i in Super) {
    if (hasOwn.call(Super, i)) {
      Constructor[i] = Super[i];
    }
  }
  return Constructor;
}
  • example usage
    ...

_Error.extend = utils.protoExtend;

/**
 * Create subclass of internal Error klass
 * (Specifically for errors returned from Stripe's REST API)
 */
var StripeError = _Error.StripeError = _Error.extend({
  type: 'StripeError',
  populate: function(raw) {
// Move from prototype def (so it appears in stringified obj)
this.type = this.type;

this.stack = (new Error(raw.message)).stack;
this.rawType = raw.type;
...

function stripe.resources.Customers.method (spec)

  • description and source-code
    function stripeMethod(spec) {
  var commandPath = typeof spec.path == 'function' ? spec.path
                  : utils.makeURLInterpolator(spec.path || '');
  var requestMethod = (spec.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
  var urlParams = spec.urlParams || [];
  var encode = spec.encode || function(data) {return data;};

  return function() {
    var self = this;
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

    var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
    var urlData = this.createUrlData();

    return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
      for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
        // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
        // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
        var arg = args[0];

        var param = urlParams[i];

        var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
        param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        if (!arg) {
          if (isOptional) {
            urlData[param] = '';
            continue;
          }

          var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
          var err = new Error(
            'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
            ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
          );
          reject(err);
          return;
        }

        urlData[param] = args.shift();
      }

      var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
      var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

      if (args.length) {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
          'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
          ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
      function requestCallback(err, response) {
        if (err) {
          reject(err);
        } else {
          resolve(
            spec.transformResponseData ?
              spec.transformResponseData(response) :
              response
          );
        }
      };

      var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
      self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
    }).bind(this)), callback);
  };
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module stripe.resources.Customers.prototype

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype._legacyCancelSubscription ()

  • description and source-code
    _legacyCancelSubscription = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

  • description and source-code
    _legacyUpdateSubscription = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

        return;

      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

    _newstyleCancelSubscription = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {

      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.

        );
        reject(err);
        return;

    }

    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

            response
        );

    };

    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);

    _newstyleUpdateSubscription = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

        reject(err);

          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );

    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype.cancelSubscription (customerId, subscriptionId)

  • description and source-code
    cancelSubscription = function (customerId, subscriptionId) {
  // This is a hack, but it lets us maximize our overloading.
  // Precarious assumption: If it's not an auth key it _could_ be a sub id:
  if (typeof subscriptionId == 'string' && !utils.isAuthKey(subscriptionId)) {
    return this._newstyleCancelSubscription.apply(this, arguments);
  } else {
    return this._legacyCancelSubscription.apply(this, arguments);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype.createCard ()

  • description and source-code
    createCard = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype.createSource ()

  • description and source-code
    createSource = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    ...
callback:

``` js
// Create a new customer and then a new charge for that customer:
stripe.customers.create({
email: 'foo-customer@example.com'
}).then(function(customer){
return stripe.customers.createSource(customer.id, {
  source: {
     object: 'card',
     exp_month: 10,
     exp_year: 2018,
     number: '4242 4242 4242 4242',
     cvc: 100
  }
...

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype.createSubscription ()

  • description and source-code
    createSubscription = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype.deleteCard ()

  • description and source-code
    deleteCard = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

function stripe.resources.Customers.prototype.deleteDiscount ()

  • description and source-code
    deleteDiscount = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      if (!arg) {
        if (isOptional) {
          urlData[param] = '';
          continue;
        }

        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
        var err = new Error(
          'Stripe: Argument "' + urlParams[i] + '" required, but got: ' + arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
      }

      urlData[param] = args.shift();
    }

    var data = encode(utils.getDataFromArgs(args));
    var opts = utils.getOptionsFromArgs(args);

    if (args.length) {
      var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);
      var err = new Error(
        'Stripe: Unknown arguments (' + args + '). Did you mean to pass an options ' +
        'object? See https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node/wiki/Passing-Options.' +
        ' (on API request to ' + requestMethod + ' `' + path + '`)'
      );
      reject(err);
      return;
    }

    var requestPath = this.createFullPath(commandPath, urlData);
    function requestCallback(err, response) {
      if (err) {
        reject(err);
      } else {
        resolve(
          spec.transformResponseData ?
            spec.transformResponseData(response) :
            response
        );
      }
    };

    var options = {headers: objectAssign(opts.headers, spec.headers)};
    self._request(requestMethod, requestPath, data, opts.auth, options, requestCallback);
  }).bind(this)), callback);
}

  • description and source-code
    deleteSource = function () {
  var self = this;
  var args = [].slice.call(arguments);

  var callback = typeof args[args.length - 1] == 'function' && args.pop();
  var urlData = this.createUrlData();

  return this.wrapTimeout(new Promise((function(resolve, reject) {
    for (var i = 0, l = urlParams.length; i < l; ++i) {
      // Note that we shift the args array after every iteration so this just
      // grabs the "next" argument for use as a URL parameter.
      var arg = args[0];

      var param = urlParams[i];

      var isOptional = OPTIONAL_REGEX.test(param);
      param = param.replace(OPTIONAL_REGEX, '');

      if (param == 'id' && typeof arg !== 'string') {
        var path = this.createResourcePathWithSymbols(spec.path);

          'Stripe: "id" must be a string, but got: ' + typeof arg +
          ' (on API request to `' + requestMethod + ' ' + path + '`)'
        );
        reject(err);
        return;
